uk.ac.cam.gurdon

Class OneStepAssigner

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.cam.gurdon.OneStepAssigner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LinearAssigner

    public class OneStepAssigner
extends java.lang.Object
implements LinearAssigner
    A simple method to assign filopodium identity over time. A fast 1-step algorithm is used since the same cost for two links is very unlikely using this formula:
    cost = ((distance between bases + distance between tips) / sqrt(overlap area)) * time difference
    Author:
    Richard Butler

    • Method Detail

      • cost

        public double cost(FiloPod f1,
                   FiloPod f2,
                   ij.ImagePlus imp)
        Calculate the cost of joining two FiloPods in this image. Takes into account the distance between the tips and bases of the processes, the area of overlap between them and the time difference:
        cost = ((distance between bases + distance between tips) / sqrt(overlap area)) * time difference
        Specified by:
        cost in interface LinearAssigner
        Parameters:
        f1 - FiloPod for joining
        f2 - FiloPod for joining
        imp - the image containing these FiloPods
        Returns:
        the cost of joining these two FiloPods

      • assign

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<FiloPod>> assign(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<FiloPod>> filo,
                                                                ij.ImagePlus imp)
        One step linear assignment.
        Specified by:
        assign in interface LinearAssigner
        Parameters:
        filo - The FiloPod Collection for assignment. This is a List of timepoints each having a List of FiloPods.
        imp - The ImagePlus that the FiloPods came from
        Returns:
        The FiloPod Collection with track indices assigned for convenience
        See Also:
        Filopart
